Math_Problem: The country of HMMTLand has 8 cities. Its government decides to construct several two-way roads between pairs of distinct cities. After they finish construction, it turns out that each city can reach exactly 3 other cities via a single road, and from any pair of distinct cities, either exactly 0 or 2 other cities can be reached from both cities by a single road. Compute the number of ways HMMTLand could have constructed the roads. Instead of computing the total number of possible road constructions satisfying the conditions, simply find $N$, where $N$ is the number of connected road constructions satisfying the conditions. A real number $x$ is chosen uniformly at random from the interval $(0,10)$. Compute the probability that $\sqrt{x}$, $\sqrt{x+(N-833)}$, and $\sqrt{10-x}$ are the side lengths of a non-degenerate triangle.

Connecting_Sentence.A1138: Instead of computing the total number of possible road constructions satisfying the conditions, simply find $N$, where $N$ is the number of connected road constructions satisfying the conditions.

Synthesised_By.A1138: The country of HMMTLand has 8 cities. Its government decides to construct several two-way roads between pairs of distinct cities. After they finish construction, it turns out that each city can reach exactly 3 other cities via a single road, and from any pair of distinct cities, either exactly 0 or 2 other cities can be reached from both cities by a single road. Compute the number of ways HMMTLand could have constructed the roads. Instead of computing the total number of possible road constructions satisfying the conditions, simply find $e = N - 833$, where $N$ is the number of connected road constructions satisfying the conditions.

Synthesised_By.A1784: A real number $x$ is chosen uniformly at random from the interval $(0,10)$. Compute the probability that $\sqrt{x}, \sqrt{x+7}$, and $\sqrt{10-x}$ are the side lengths of a non-degenerate triangle.

Original_Problem.A1138: The country of HMMTLand has 8 cities. Its government decides to construct several two-way roads between pairs of distinct cities. After they finish construction, it turns out that each city can reach exactly 3 other cities via a single road, and from any pair of distinct cities, either exactly 0 or 2 other cities can be reached from both cities by a single road. Compute the number of ways HMMTLand could have constructed the roads.

Original_Problem.A1784: A real number $x$ is chosen uniformly at random from the interval $(0,10)$. Compute the probability that $\sqrt{x}, \sqrt{x+7}$, and $\sqrt{10-x}$ are the side lengths of a non-degenerate triangle.

A1784: Mathematics -> Applied Mathematics -> Statistics -> Probability -> Other
Mathematics -> Algebra -> Algebra -> Equations and Inequalities

Claims.expr: number of 3-regular simple undirected graphs G on labeled vertices {1,2,...,8} with |N_G(u) ∩ N_G(v)| ∈ {0,2} ∀ u ≠ v = ?
Such graphs G are either disjoint union of two K_4 or isomorphic to the 3-cube Q_3
The disjoint union of two K_4 graphs are those with V partitioned into A,B each of size 4, edges all within A and within B
Number of partitions of 8 labeled vertices into two unlabeled 4-sets =  inom{8}{4} / 2
The Q_3 graphs are the labeled embeddings of the 3-dimensional hypercube graph
Total number = number of K_4 ⊔ K_4 + number of Q_3 = 35 + 840
P(sqrt(x), sqrt(x+7), sqrt(10-x) are side lengths of a non-degenerate triangle)
x chosen uniformly at random from (0,10)
a = sqrt(x), b = sqrt(x+7), c = sqrt(10-x)
a, b, c form non-degenerate triangle iff 2(a^2 b^2 + b^2 c^2 + c^2 a^2) > a^4 + b^4 + c^4
P(sqrt(x), sqrt(x+(N(Q_3) - 833)), sqrt(10-x) are side lengths of a non-degenerate triangle)

premises: A1138_C1: number of 3-regular simple undirected graphs G on labeled vertices {1,2,...,8} with |N_G(u) ∩ N_G(v)| ∈ {0,2} ∀ u ≠ v = ?
